publicationstmt.publisher: Published by and available from the William Blake Archive, http://www.blakearchive.org

availability.p: Â©2008 Morris Eaves, Robert N. Essick, Joseph Viscomi.

projectdesc.p: These collection lists were prepared for the William Blake Archive.

p.hi: None of the works in these collection lists is held at the offices of the William Blake Archive. Please contact the owning institution if you desire further information or wish to make arrangements to view any works.

figure.teiform: The Ian Potter Centre of the National Gallery of Victoria, Melbourne

body.p: Note: numbers in parentheses following the accession numbers are the entry numbers in Martin Butlin and Ted Gott, William Blake in the Collection of the National Gallery of Victoria (Melbourne: National Gallery of Victoria, 1989).

div1.head: Illuminated Books
div1.bibl: Europe a Prophecy. Plate 11 only.Accession no. 1027/3 (42)
Large Book of Designs,copy B:The First Book of Urizen. Plate 21 only.Accession no. 1028/3 (43)
Songs of Innocence, copy X.Accession nos. P122a-g/1988 (39)

div2.head: Designed and Engraved by Blake
div2.bibl: Virgil. The Pastorals of Virgil. 1821. Plates 6-13, 15-17, 22-24 (14 of Blake's 17 wood engravings) only, Linnell impressions.Accession nos. OS 16-29 (48)
Young, Edward. The Complaint, and the Consolation; or, Night Thoughts. 1797. Hand colored copy.Accession nos. P.183I-xliii (51)

div2.head: Designed by Blake and Engraved by Other Engravers
div2.bibl: Blair, Robert. The Grave. 1808 quarto.Accession nos. 3153.a-m/4 (44)

div2.head: Engraved by Blake after Designs by Other Artists
div2.bibl: Cumberland, George. Thoughts on Outline. 1796. Accession nos. OS 30.a-x (41)
Hunter, John. An Historical Journal. 1793 quarto.Plate only.Accession no. P.8/1974 (40)
Rees, Abraham. The Cyclopaedia. 1820. Plate 4 only.Accession no. OS 31 (46)

div1.head: Separate Prints and Prints in Series

Slight Sketch, Perhaps of Hills

Slight Sketch for 'Cacus'

The Six-Footed Serpent Attacking Agnello dei Brunelleschi
